player: Dwight Howard is resting Monday vs. the Knicks.

J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Andrew Bogut (hamstring) will be out for "the near future," according to coach Rick Carlisle.

Clint Capela (knee) will return to the starting lineup Tuesday night in Miami, but will "probably" play fewer than 20 minutes.

Chris Paul will receive an MRI on his injured left thumb on Tuesday.

Deyonta Davis (foot) will be active and available to play Wednesday vs. the Thunder.
Brandan Wright (left ankle) has started full-speed individual workouts and hopes to make his season debut in January.

Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Anthony Davis (right hip, left thumb) is being listed as questionable for Wednesday's game against the Magic.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.

Nerlens Noel (ankle) said he expects to play Wednesday vs. the Raptors.

because of an impending knee surgery.

George Hill 7-of-18 shots and 1-of-8 3-pointers for 17 points, eight rebounds and three assists in 33 minutes of Monday's win over the Suns.
